Detailed Description

Display information functions.

Author:
R.D.Paterson
Date:
2001/04/15 Creation 2002/05/07 RDP: XuCloseDisplay() removed. 2005/12/20 RDP: XuIsValidDisplayString added and many code changes to include the visual setting.

Function Documentation

Display* XuIsValidDisplayString (  String  display_string  ) 
 

Returns a display pointer if the given string is a valid display.

Parameters:
[in] display_string A string representing a display (host:display.screen)
Returns:
The display pointer or NULL if not a valid display.

String XuStandardDisplayString (  String  display_string  ) 
 

Put the given display string into a standard format.

Parameters:
[in] display_string A display string that may be a partial representation of the display such as ":0"
Returns:
A display string in the standard format
Attention:
The returned string is allocated memory which must be freed by the calling application.

void XuUpdateDisplay (  Widget  w  ) 
 

Update of all displays.

Update all displays opened by the Xu library

Parameters:
[in] w Reference widget of a display
Note:
The widget is not actually used but is included for compatability with XmUpdateDisplay, so the argument can be NULL.
